title: Simple Weed Question Destroys Drug Czar's Chief Deputy

comments.text:
Im from Holland - we can smoke all day all night anywhere....
not one person ahs ever died or assaulted or caused any harm to any human 
being in our country.
Watching this debate from my country and knowing how many killing and 
shootings you guys have in the US, a country that has no universal 
healthcare, allows everyone to own a gun, and being shot and executed by 
the police, with each other on street corners....and the fact in your 
country you guys advertise prescription drugs on national tv, is mind 
bugling. 
This is a debate? how dangerous weed is, when not one single person has 
ever died anywhere, especially in our country where its legal and normal, 
like alcohol in your country.
I mean no offense, I see a lot of american are liberal and they'd be like 
us and have the same liberal mind set. But Americans should not be 
offended, why we Europeans think, you guys are dumb,literally and centuries 
behind us....
I mean every week we hear how American cops kill in your country folks who 
are unarmed...or how 20 elementary school kids are being killed.
But the debate is about weed? that hasnt killed a soul in the world?  WOW﻿

pot is not a fucking "drug" its a herb, the closest thing we have to fight

allowed to buy the most death related drug in the world before they even

and the only plant on this planet is illegal for some strange reason...

this plant is illegal﻿

comments.text:
Marijuana is easy to grow, prepare into a cigarette and smoke. Tobacco is 
far more complex. Because it is complex, it is commerciable and taxable. 
Being also more fun to smoke and potentially free, if marijuana is 
legalised, it will obliterate tobacco sales.

The problem the government has with marijuana is not the health dangers 
(which are lower in relation to tobacco, if smoked with a filter), but the 
reduction in fiscal taxation.﻿

comments.author: Jacob Little

comments.text:
In all fairness, marijuana is not entirely harmless. Several studies have 
found that prolonged use of marijuana produces a distinct cluster that 
appear with a fairly degree of reliability upon stopping use of marijuana. 
These symptoms are mainly psychological, with some studies finding some 
degree of physical (increased sweating and heart rate) symptoms as well. 
These are not severe symptoms, and they only occur with intense daily use. 
But it's not a drug that one should be arrested for using or EVEN selling.﻿

comments.author: Robert Phillips

comments.text:
Yes - this is why conservatives hate government!

I am a strong fiscal conservative (more of a libertarian) and oppose the 
welfare state & minimum wage law (I think we should replace all that with 
the negative income tax)...  I oppose federally run schools (we should 
transition it with vouchers & school choice).  I tend to find TYT overly 
emotional and often very one-sided on a lot of issues, and they tend to 
demonize Republican stances by cherry picking extremists (like religious 
nutts) or twisting things like "oh you don't want men to be treated like 
garbage, you must be anti-women" etc.

However, I am 100% on-board with legalizing marijuana.  I wouldn't use it, 
but it's relatively harmless.  Treat marijuana problems as a public health 
issue (and maybe a potential social ill) - not as a criminal issue.  The 
police state & the prison industrial complex does not solve all problems!

TYT stop being so anti-Republic.  Let's get together based on specific 
issues (not party lines) and fight the police state.  We need good law 
enforcement who is accountable for their actions.  We need humane prison 
systems that focus on rehabilitation and protecting us from people who are 
actually dangerous.  And we need to end the war on drugs - starting with 
the complete legalization of marijuana.

Finally let me add that the "bust black kids" garbage is leftist 
propaganda. Yes it's true that there may exist racism and injustice against 
blacks in the criminal justice system... But let's also not deny the simple 
fact that blacks do commit more crimes. Not all blacks, and this says 
nothing about any individual person who happens to be "black" (in fact, I'd 
argue that most of our common conception of "race" is based more on culture 
than on biology). So TYT you can address the marijuana issue without 
spouting leftist propaganda and trying to turn everything into some kind of 
appeal to a demographic group like "oh we want to help blacks because they 
are oppressed". Guess what - non-"black" people (or people who are 
partially black) have their lives ruined by the drug war too! So don't sit 
over there and pretend like you have to be "black" to get your life ruined 
by the police state.

It breeds contempt for the law and disrespect for law enforcement - TYT you 
are absolutely right, and Miltion Friedman the great libertarian free 
market economist agrees. The way he put it was "inimical to the moral 
fabric of society". Milton Freedman gave the historical example of corn 
laws in Great Britan causing an adverse effect on culture that caused more 
crime and corruption. When the law is absurd, more people lose respect for 
the law, and more people stray from being adult respectable responsible 
upright honest hard-working individuals, and some will even enter a life of 
crime, and some they start a life of breaking only absurd laws but once 
they are in that lifestyle they will break other laws too. It also makes 
the USA government look bad to the USA public, and our credibility to other 
countries.﻿

comments.author: khr1379

comments.text:
Once kids realized the school and the dare program we were all forced to 
take in America during my generation were full of shit about weed, it was 
way easier to think they were full of shit about all of it. The truth is 
sometimes they were. Hallucinogenic drugs were said to be far more 
dangerous than most truly are. I was told there was a high likelihood of 
dying from using cocaine just one time. Even the concept of addiction was 
never adequately explained to us. They would just say it means "you need 
it". They need to be saying it means if you don't have your heroin for 
12hrs or so you will start shaking as your bones ache horribly while 
your crapping your pants as you puke your guts out and feel like your 
freezing even though its 80 degrees, and if you are stupid enough to get 
involved with the heroin scene that's what WILL happen to you. That might 
actually get a kid to stop and think about what hes doing before he makes a 
mistake. Instead they lie and exaggerate about the least harmfull, and 
somewhat harmful drugs when they should be throwing almost all their 
resources at things like heroin, and meth.﻿
comments.author: Brian Scholla

comments.text:
Was listening with an open mind until the comment was made about weed not 
being harmful and about living under a rock. 

That is not a fact and therefor anything that comes after that is based on 
something that isn't true. 

Scientific evidence says the smoke from it is harmful, just as cigarette 
smoke has been proven to be harmful. That is a fact. 

Whether it should be illegal is a different matter. I'm not convinced it 
should be illegal. However, I can't listen to someone make a statement as 
fact that is not without losing respect for that persons creditability. 

People who want it to be legal need to stop arguing untrue items, in my 
opinion. 

The fact is that no one has got a right to tell anyone that they can't use 
this or that item. 

Legalize it all and let communities and parents teach their kids to make 
the right choices. 

Those that don't will pay a consequence. ﻿

In my own personal experience, it seems to me that MJ might have 
contributed significantly to saving my life.
Back in ´99 I spent 9 months in an institution way out in the woods for

more dose was pretty intense. I ended up, as I was on my way to score, 
dropping into a town in which a good mate was living, who smoked. I 
basically demanded a bowl, just in case that would help, and as it coursed 
through my body, the strain and tension seemed to physically flow out of my 
body, and suddenlly my mission was abondoned for ever and it was more than 
enough just to be able to take a walk to the local café  for some eats

cindybin2001
+Tdot heisenberg AARGGHHHH OH YOU PEOPLE ARE HORRIBLE! HORRIBLE! Comments 
like yours only make me angrier and MORE determined to speak up against 
pot! I have said over and over how furious it makes me when you guys blame 
my religion on my stance on drugs! I wasn't even religious in high school 
or college and I sure never smoked pot, and my husband is not Mormon and HE 
wouldn't smoke pot, and neither would anybody we know, religious or not! 
STOP BLAMING MY RELIGION ON THIS! I don't say anything that any other 
parent wouldn't say! All I am saying is that we shouldn't use mind-altering 
drugs to get high, stoned, buzzed, relax, have "fun", enjoy life, etc. This 
is good morals and just plain common sense! And pot is ILLEGAL! You can get 
into big trouble if you get busted! Parents HAVE to tell their kids to obey 
the law! CAN'T YOU SEE THAT?? What is WRONG with you people, putting me 
down just for saying we shouldn't use drugs and that you can get into 
trouble if you get busted???

And you must be the 200th Internet person just this week to tell me that 
nobody has died or overdosed on "weed". I KNOW THAT! I KNOW THAT! I KNOW 
THAT! The entire reason I have been forced to continue speaking up against 
pot all these years is because of all you JERKS who always think that I am 
against pot because I think it's all dangerous and deadly and "ruins your 
life." NOBODY THINKS THAT! Doesn't it even OCCUR to you idiots that we are 
against pot because it's a mind-altering drug?? Pot smokers ADMIT to us all 
the time online that they use it to get high, stoned, buzzed, relax, have 
"fun", etc. And that is why we are against it! That is what makes it wrong! 
We shouldn't use mind-altering drugs for these reasons! This is good morals 
and just plain common sense! What parent would ever raise their kids to 
grow up and smoke POT?? And I say the same things about alcohol! I rant 
against alcohol all the time, too--even more than pot! A casual booze 
drinker is no better than a casual pot smoker, except they aren't breaking 
the law! CAN'T YOU SEE MY POINT???

And then you bring up MEDICAL MARIJUANA??? MEDICAL MARIJUANA? Oh you have 
really done it now!! Oh this makes me FURIOUS when you mean guys bring up 
medical marijuana!!! Have you not read a THING I have written over the 
years?? I have said over and over that I am NOT AGAINST MEDICAL MARIJUANA! 
That is a totally different issue! I am a nice person and of course would 
not want someone to suffer! If marijuana truly helps someone with a true 
medical condition, then of course that is a good thing! I would use it 
myself if I had to, if it worked and were legal for that! I have been 
trying for YEARS to write an article on the BENEFITS OF MEDICAL MARIJUANA! 
But I have yet to find a single decent person to interview to use as an 
example in my article! All the casual users rave about the medical benefits 
in order to justify getting  high, and even the "medical" users I've talked 
to and seen online have been horrible like the casual users, cussing me 
out, threatening me with death and bodily harm, attacking my religion, my 
looks, my sex life, making mean videos and websites about me, making fun of 
me for collecting dolls, etc. etc. etc. I have collected THOUSANDS of 
comments and emails from "medical" users, supporters and growers who are 
just HORRIBLE. Now all I want to do is write articles and make videos using 
these comments, to show what people are like! Doctors, lawmakers and the 
entire public needs to know!

It is just SOOOO depressing. I always thought MEDICAL users would be nice, 
that surely they would agree that we shouldn't use mind-altering drugs 
recreationally. What parent would ever raise their kids to grow up and get 
high on pot? At any age? And we shouldn't use alcohol, either! I say the 
same things against alcohol! Alcohol is a drug! Just because it's legal 
doesn't make it right! Can't you see my point?? All I am saying is that we 
shouldn't use mind-altering drugs to get high, stoned, buzzed, relax, have 
"fun", enjoy life, celebrate, socialize, etc. This is good morals and just 
plain common sense!

If you told me NICELY that you are all about MEDICAL marijuana, I would 
have gladly supported you and offered to interview you for the article I 
have been TRYING to write on the benefits of MEDICAL MARIJUANA. But how can 
I support you after all you have said to me?? Now I have to add your 
comments to my huge folder filled with all the other THOUSANDS of comments 
and emails from "medical" users, supporters and growers. It is just SOOO 
depressing. I can't believe people are like this. Aren't there ANY nice, 
true medical users out there??﻿

comments.author: James Reeves

comments.text:
+cindybin2001 "Get a girlfriend"????  I'm gay Ms. Cindybin.  Are you blind? 
 You can't tell from my picture?  Duh.  And now you're gonna tell me about 
all the moral pitfalls of being gay, I suppose.

Ms. Cindybin, there is nothing wrong with using mind altering substances. 
 Since the beginning of time, man has always used substances to alter their 
mind.  Ancient civilizations even used mind altering substances as part of 
their religious rituals.  There is nothing wrong with taking your mind to 
another reality.  As a matter of fact, it is healthy to take your mind away 
from the stress of everyday life.  Some do it with alcohol, some do it with 
sugar & sweets, some do it with a Fatburger.... I just happen to do it with 
drugs.  It's all just the same.  Altering one's reality in a responsible 
way is not wrong or sinful; it is a natural state that man has always 
sought and always will seek.  That is why the war on drugs has been such a 
disaster for America.

Save yourself the effort and don't respond.  I'm done with you.  In all 
your voluminous writing, you have yet to explain why you think drugs are 
wrong.  Other than to say people shouldn't be doing mind altering drugs, 
you haven't given a valid reason as to why they are wrong, except that you 
give your opinion as fact.  Just because you say it is wrong, does not make 
it wrong.  In order to convince somebody of your point, you have to give 
reasons that are more than just your opinion.  That is why with all your 
writing, you still haven't convinced anyone of your argument.

Anyway, I'm gone. Have a nice life.  Toodles.

That''s All.

comments.text:
+cindybin2001   Yes, I know several psychologists that would read these 
posts, if asked, and render a professional opinion.  It's really not that 
hard to find a mental health counselor.  They have them at school 
districts, community colleges, and 4-year colleges, plus those who work 
independently.  For someone who describes herself as an older woman, you 
seem out of touch with regard to finding a mental health counselor.  Heck, 
if you called the mental health department of your city, they would be able 
to put you in touch with a counselor.  It's really not that hard.  But I 
can see that you are already trying to wiggle out of my proposition by 
making it sound like you don't know where to find a mental health counselor.

As for your other questions... I am 25 years old; my parents are at their 
home (where else would they be);  they don't know that I'm specifically 
"like this" with you, but they do know that I have enough intelligence to 
question assertions when I disagree with them (like your assertions);  I 
have smoked pot on a few occasions, but I didn't like the trip it took me 
on.  I prefer to be up, rather than down.  So, I like crystal meth a lot 
more because it makes me feel like I'm king of the world!  Plus, it's less 
expensive than cocaine.

And before you go on one of your rants about how drugs screw one up and 
they are illegal, I'll have you know that I graduated summa cum laude from 
one of the top 10 universities in the US and I have a MBA from one of the 
top 5 business schools in the US.  So, drugs obviously haven't screwed me 
up.  As far as them being illegal, I don't care.  I know the risks.  I am 
safe with my use so that I don't attract police attention.  And I'm 
responsible for my own actions.  I don't tell others what to do with their 
lives and, conversely, I don't allow people to tell me what to do with my 
life.

It is not for some meddling, doll-collecting, busy-body to tell me how to 
live my life.  I know the risks all the way around and am willing to accept 
them and, to date, my life has been spectacular.  So, stop trying to treat 
me and everyone else like you are their mother; you aren't.  My own mother 
doesn't meddle as much as you do.  You are just a sad, mentally-touched 
woman who has way too much time on her hands.  Get a grip.  Now I'm off to 
smoke a bowl.

That's All.
comments.author: Daniel Jr

+Eddie Gluskin AARGGHHH Have you not read a thing I have written over the 
years?? I have said a billion times over the past ten years that I haven't 
SEEN "weed." That doesn't mean I don't KNOW anything about it! You don't 
have to have seen or smoked pot to know what people use it for!!! 

And it makes me FURIOUS that you guys always accuse me of thinking that pot 
is dangerous and deadly, etc. NOBODY THINKS THAT! Doesn't it even OCCUR to 
you that we are against it because it's a mind-altering drug??? I say the 
same things against alcohol! I rant against alcohol all the time, too--even 
more than pot! Haven't you read a THING I have written??

Oh this is just SOOOO FRUSTRATING. I type my fingers to the bone for YEARS, 
thinking you guys will finally understand, and you all still say the same 
things over and over!!! I just want to scream!!! This is the entire reason 
I have to continue speaking up against pot, is because of comments like 
yours! You honestly expect me to say, "Oh wow, you are right. I don't know 
a THING about WEED, and I always thought it was dangerous and deadly and 
killed people. But now I see your point that alcohol is the real killer! 
That makes it okay to get high on POT!"

Oh brother. YOU PEOPLE ARE DRIVING ME INSANE! I want my life back! I never 
even THOUGHT about pot before all this!!! But boy have you guys opened my 
eyes! now I realize that we all need to speak up against pot and that it 
should be illegal forever, with VERY STIFF PENALTIES! Not because of 
marijuana itself, but because of the people who use and defend it! Like you!

Oh this makes me so mad. I type my fingers to the bone for TEN YEARS, 
writing thousands of comments, tons of blogs, even a BOOK about why we 
shouldn't smoke pot or drink alcohol and how furious it makes us all when 
you guys use the lame excuse that pot is safer than alcohol and when you 
all accuse us of being against pot because we think it's dangerous and 
deadly and addictive!!! AND YET YOU ALL STILL SAY THE SAME THINGS! I wish I 
could devote 24 hours a day to speaking up and EDUCATING you morons!!
comments.author: cindybin2001

comments.text:
+cindybin2001 K. Lol I'm gonna just go roll a blunt now and play Call of 
Duty have fun trolling.
comments.author: Ray Rogers

comments.text:
+Ray Rogers AARGGHHHHH YOU CAN'T COMPARE "NATURALLY" ALTERING YOUR MIND TO 
PURPOSELY INGESTING A MIND-ALTERING DRUG INTO YOUR SYSTEM! CAN'T YOU SEE 
THAT??? ARE YOU THAT STUPID AND DENSE???
comments.author: cindybin2001

comments.text:
+Ray Rogers I CAN'T BELIEVE IT! Even after ALL I HAVE SAID to you, you 
would still call me a "troll" and accuse me of having mental health issues? 
YOU ARE JUST HORRIBLE!!!!! I don't say anything that any other parent 
wouldn't say! What parent would ever raise their kids to grow up and get 
high on POT?? At any age?? Most parents try to teach their kids morals, 
values and common sense to know that this is wrong and just plain immature! 
And it is ILLEGAL! Parents HAVE to teach their kids to obey the law! No 
parent wants to bail their child out of jail and have them face a stern, 
harsh judge who treats them like dirt! No parent wants their child to lose 
their college scholarship or job opportunities! If you were a parent, you 
would feel the same way! But even if pot were legal, I sure don't know ANY 
parents who would approve of drug us! And again, it IS a drug when you use 
it to get high and have "fun"! And we shouldn't use alcohol, either! I know 
many of these same parents who would NEVER smoke pot because "drugs are 
bad" think nothing of using a mind-altering drug in the form of alcohol. 
But they are hypocrites!

Oh this makes me so mad. I busted a gut to honestly and sincerely talk to 
you, to HELP you, and you REJECTED it, and you still say that I am a 
"troll" with mental issues, etc. WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU???

And again, YOU are the one who thinks that people are against pot because 
they think it's all dangerous and deadly and addictive. You told me about 
how it's safer than alcohol and cigarettes, etc. We all have to EDUCATE you 
guys who think this! So many pot smokers think this! They just don't get 
it! It doesn't even occur to them that we are against pot because it's a 
MIND-ALTERING DRUG! Not because we think it's all dangerous and deadly and 
addictive!

Oh I just want to cry. I can't believe it. I busted a gut to honestly and 
sincerely talk to you, and you REJECTED it. You are just HORRIBLE. If you 
were my son, I would ground you for life. 

Good luck trying to find a nice, decent young lady to date or marry. No 
NICE woman is ever going to want to date or marry a POT SMOKER.
comments.author: cindybin2001

answer it, then he would also have to answer the follow-up question: "which

says he don't know, or that marijuana is worse, he would clearly be lying.

comments.author: Tommy lee

comments.text:
Meth/cocaine more addictive? Yes, every time... He should have just left it 
at that because asking which is more dangerous depends on a lot of factors. 
There is not straight answer to that. A milligram of meth up the nose is 
probably healthier than 20 bongs a day for the rest of my life....so it's 
kinda relative.﻿
comments.author: Jimi Jones

comments.text:
+HeartOfSky DCUO My point was that "dangerous" is less specific than 
"addictive".

So asking someone like Mr Boticelli in this video, who's clearly being 
evasive and trying to avoid giving a direct, clear answer, the question 
allows him to weasel out of it a little bit easier and beat around the bush.

Are meth/cocaine more addictive? Nobody could seriously answer anything 
other than "yes".
But more dangerous? Like I say, that's less well defined. *Of course we 
know meth is more dangerous*, but it would be easier to avoid giving a 
direct response to that question.
{For example, at some point methamphetamine must have been FDA approved (I 
assume, since it was prescribed) but as far as I know, marijuana has not 
(?)}.

As for 20 bongs vs 1 mg, I guess that's speculation, experience, common 
sense. Again, just making the point that marijuana *could* be considered 
more dangerous in some extreme circumstances, but it could never seriously 
be considered more addictive.

Meh...just sayin
comments.author: Jimi Jones

comments.text:
But you're running purely off of speculation with your 1mg of meth vs 20 
bong hits. Unless there was a study comparing the two, you're just using 
conjecture to justify your belief.

Fact of the matter is... for all off the people who have had massive 
addictions, health deterioration, and loss of life as a result of meth far 
out number those who use marijuana. Yet... marijuana is used in much 
greater quantities than meth. One is notoriously physically addictive, 
whilst the other may be useful for "self medication", but in and of itself 
is not physically addictive.
comments.author: HeartOfSky DCUO
